instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D7701: What is D7701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Board chimes, fan spins
no display

L8304 black and cracked in half
replaced it..still no display
now 3.3V for 1-2 seconds measured at pin 2 after power applied

<RESISTOR>R8364</RESISTOR> look a little worn so replaced it
lvds J8300 connector looks good
no water damage

usb mouse lights up
1.8V at cpu inductors

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Check <RESISTOR>R8360</RESISTOR>.
Do you get 2.5V there at same time with 3V at L8304?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
2.67V at <RESISTOR>R8360</RESISTOR>

F7700 measures OL across it
it should be continuous no? like ~0.3ohms
8.67V at pin 1 ...0.30 at pin 2 of the fuse

fuse is blown?
that would explain the cracked inductor

i just can’t believe that is it

i checked 10 times to be sure
i don’t get an image-at least one I can see or a backlight

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Replace fuse and check for shorts to ground on both pins of <DIODE>D7701</DIODE>; w/ and w/o LCD connected.
However, the big problem is missing voltage at pins 18/19 of J8300.

"2.67V at <RESISTOR>R8360</RESISTOR>"
Both pins?
If <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> goes high, PCH should recognize LCD correctly.

Check <RESISTOR>R8361</RESISTOR>/62 and pull down resistors from <SIGNAL>DP_INT</SIGNAL> lines.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Changed fuse.
Checked diode.
Checked resistors indicated above.

Connected machine.
Machine now boots to LCD.

Solved!

Thanks informaticos!!
